channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024031435
item.description:
Report X-2024031435

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: SECAUCUS
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THREE AIR PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH WERE GIVEN TO A RESPONDER TO INSPECT. THESE THREE PACKAGES WERE IN THE SORT WITH IDENTICAL PACKAGES THAT WERE PROPERLY MARKED AS CONTAINING DRY ICE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY ONE POUND OF DRY ICE COOLING COOKIE DOUGH. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO OTHER CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1Z2001630233569096 AND 1Z2001630218993218. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM NJ USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 200163, QVC / FAIRFIELD GOURMET FOOD, 11 CLIFFSIDE DR, CEDAR GROVE NJ 07009-1234.

item.title: Report X-2024031384
item.description:
Report X-2024031384

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE OF FOUR BOTTLES OF REAGENT ALCOHOL 200 PROOF WAS FOUND TO BE 100% LEAKED OUT. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF REAGENT ALCOHOL 200 PROOF COULD CAUSE FROM PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 34 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION UNLESS OTHERWISE.

THE REMAINING CONTENT WAS PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF 70% ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL COULD CAUSE FROM PACKAGE BEING MISHANDLED OR DROPPED.   • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE (1) OF FOUR (4) BOTTLES OF CIDECON II WAS FOUND TO BE SLIGHTLY LEAKING (5%) FROM A LOOSE CAP. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF CIDECON II CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED.   • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION 1 OF 4 BOTTLES OF ECOLAB ECOTEMP PHASE 1 DETERGENT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING, THE CAP WAS TIGHTHEN. ALL OF 4 BOTTLES WERE THEN PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF ECOLAB ECOTEMP PHASE 1 DETERGENT COULD CAUSE FROM PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SLAVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

  • Description: 1.X-2024031353 SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort in a plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection showed most of package lost, with 2 of 4 items missing. Damage most likely caused from falling during transit and items becoming scattered before found. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless othewise stated. 2. X-2024031405 SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT BOX WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE, UPON INSPECTION BOTTLES OF ZEP CALCIUM LIME AND RUST STAIN REMOVER WAS MISSING FROM THE BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND TORN IT WAS PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE INSIDE A CLEAR HAZMAT BOX. THIS PACKAGE WILL BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF ZEP CALCIUM LIME AND RUST STAIN REMOVER COULD CAUSE FROM THE PACKAG BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: CONTENT WAS PLACED IN A CLEAR HAZMAT BAG TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024031171
item.description:
Report X-2024031171

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PKG TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND CONTACTED ME. I THEN REPACKED THE 3 GOOD BOTTLES INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM AND THE OTHER 4TH BOTTLE INTO A WHITE SALVAGE DRUM. APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP LEAKED FROM ONE OF THE PART B BOTTLES DUE TO A LOOSE CAP. AWAITING THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP OF LIQUID TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND THEN HAVING ME REPACK IT INTO SALVAGE DRUMS IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER.

item.title: Report X-2024031213
item.description:
Report X-2024031213

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: KEASBEY

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon inspection; inside an overpacked box there are four 5 Liter bottles of Rapicide PA. Two are Rapicide PA Part B and the other two are Rapicide PA part A. One of the caps were loose on the Rapicide part B bottles causing leakage throughout the box. Due to the leakage the box was wet and tore apart. DescribePack: The cap was loose on one of the Rapicide PA Part B bottles. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: bottles were placed inside a hazardous materials plastic bag and packed inside a yellow salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2024030494
item.description:
Report E-2024030494

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T15:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: JERSEY CITY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8ft-by-3ft area of the asphalt lot and two (2) areas of the trailer floor measuring 8ft-by-15ft and 8ft-by-4ft and estimated that twenty-five (25) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. First Call Environmental personnel neutralized the impacted areas and the impacted wooden pallet and used absorbents to collect the material. The wooded pallet was broken down and placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted absorbents were recovered and containerized into two (2) 55- gallon poly drums. The remaining product in the damaged poly tote was transferred to a new tote and the damaged tote was cut up and placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024100057
item.description:
Report I-2024100057

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T00:34:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer approached aft F As with their vape placed in a blue cold cup Customer advised the vape had exploded in their bag during the flight Customer claimed they were not using the device when it malfunctioned FAs witnessed vape smoke slowly leaking out of the device though it was not on FAs stated the device did not appear to be hot as the customer was holding it their hands FAs placed vape device in TCB using the thermal gloves as they did not want to risk burning themselves FAs then poured water in the TCB, on the vape device, out of an abundance of caution.

item.title: Report I-2023120037
item.description:
Report I-2023120037

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T00:34:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: ELIZABETH
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Carteret Disposal Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Thursday, September 7, 2023, Carteret Disposal received a call from a customer, Lind Line, LLC (from Bill LNU), for the delivery of an additional 30 yard container, to their warehouse. Land Line has an arrangement with DNG Transport that they (Land Line) are in charge of ordering containers for the property. DNG Transport is a repeat customer that routinely orders 30 yard containers for what is historically Type-13 waste. Bill requested that the container be placed adjacent to the CDI container that was already on the property. On Friday, September 8th, CDI delivered the container requested, and placed the container were instructed, which was next to the dock door on the property. On Monday, September 11th, Land Line called for a switch of a container, without specifying exactly which container was to be swapped. That evening, a Roll-Off tractor was dispatched to the Land Line address for the switch. The Driver of our Truck informed me that upon arrival, he viewed two containers, one filled 100% with neatly stacked pallets, and another that was approximately only 75% filled with waste. Based on the past practice with this customer, the Driver instinctively removed the container that was 100% filled. Our records indicate that at 8:46 pm, the container was delivered/dumped at the Waste Management, Inc., Front Street facility. The next day, Tuesday, September 12th, I received a call from a manager at the WMI Front Street facility, who indicated that the load from the night before consisted of flammable hand sanitizer, which was prohibited from being accepted at the facility. This was the first that I or anyone else at CDI was advised or made aware of the actual contents of the, container, as we were led to believe that the contents of the container contained exclusively Type-13
